title: YARD / HANGED MAN BOOTS
description: If Kim is not there, you can take off the boots once the body is down.

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I thought we decided to leave it t..."
dialogueTree.english: "I thought we decided to leave it to Processing." The lieutenant shakes his head. "Let's not turn this into some kind of circus."
dialogueTree.polish: „Myślałem, że postanowiliśmy zostawić to koronerowi” – porucznik kręci głową. „Nie róbmy z tego jakiegoś cyrku”.
dialogueTree.belarusian: «Я думаў, што мы вырашылі пакінуць гэта каронеру», — лейтэнант ківае галавой. «Не будзем ператвараць гэта ў цырк».

links.title: Interfacing: "Damn it, this is turning into some..."
links.english: Damn it, this is turning into some sort of mega-puzzle.
links.polish: Cholera, robi się z tego powoli jakaś megazagadka.
links.belarusian: Халера, з гэтага павольна ствараецца нейкая мегазагадка.

links.title: Logic: "Okay, so you can *sneak* out of you..."
links.english: Okay, so you can *sneak* out of your room maybe, after he's gone asleep...
links.polish: No dobrze, w takim razie może dałoby radę *wykraść* się z pokoju, kiedy już pójdzie spać...
links.belarusian: Ну добра, у такім выпадку можа атрымалася б *выкрасьціся* з пакоя, калі ўжо пойдзе спаць...

dialogueTree.title: The Hanged Man: "The body is reluctant to let go of..."
dialogueTree.english: The body is reluctant to let go of the boots -- as though they were its last bit of dignity.
dialogueTree.polish: Ciało nie chce rozstawać się z butami. Jakby stanowiły jego ostatnią resztkę godności.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Цела не хоча раставацца з абуткам. Нібыта яны былі яго апошняй рэшткай годнасці.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "You're going to need to summon all..."
links.english: You're going to need to summon all your strength for this undertaking.
links.polish: Aby to zrobić, będziesz musiał użyć całej swojej siły.
links.belarusian: Каб гэта зрабіць, табе спатрэбіцца ўся твая сіла.

links.title: Ice Bear Fridge: "Whatever you're planning to do, you..."
links.english: Whatever you're planning to do, you need to do it before you catch pneumonia in the cold draft coming from deep inside the fridge.
links.polish: Cokolwiek zamierzasz zrobić, musisz się pospieszyć, zanim zimny powiew z głębi lodówki nie przyprawi cię o zapalenie płuc.
links.belarusian: Што б ты ні збіраўся зрабіць, табе трэба паскорыцца, пакуль халодны павеў з глыбіні халадзільніка не прывёў цябе да запалення лёгач.

links.title: You: "Pull on the right boot."
links.english: Pull on the right boot.
links.polish: Pociągnij za prawy but.
links.belarusian: Пацягні за правы бот.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "It's not completely useless. You're..."
links.english: It's not completely useless. You're able to reveal a little more of the putrid polymer sock beneath the boot.
links.polish: Jakiś efekt jest – udało ci się odsłonić spod buta większy kawałek trupiej, polimerowej skarpety.
links.belarusian: Нейкі эфект ёсць — табе ўдалося вызваліць з-пад абутку большы кавалак мёртвага, палімернага шкарпэтка.

links.title: Interfacing: "Just relax. This is easy. This is *..."
links.english: Just relax. This is easy. This is *happening*.
links.polish: Spokojnie. To łatwe. To się *dzieje*.
links.belarusian: Спакойна. Гэта лёгка. Гэта *здзяйсняецца*.

links.title: Empathy: "See? The corpse doesn't care if you..."
links.english: See? The corpse doesn't care if you try to take his boots. He doesn't need them. He's probably *glad* to get rid of them.
links.polish: Widzisz? Trupa nie obchodzi, że bierzesz sobie jego buty. Nie potrzebuje ich. Pewnie się *cieszy*, że może je zdjąć.
links.belarusian: Бачыш? Трупу ўсё роўна, што ты бярэш яго абутак. Ён іх не патрэбны. Пэўна, ён нават *радасны*, што можа іх зняць.

links.title: You: "Pick up the body and try to shake t..."
links.english: Pick up the body and try to shake the boots off.
links.polish: Podnieś ciało i spróbuj nim potrząsnąć, aby zsunąć buty.
links.belarusian: Падыміце цела і паспрабуйце патрэсці ім, каб сцягнуць чаравікі.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "It's heavier than you'd think. You'..."
links.english: It's heavier than you'd think. You're forced to drop it back down immediately. The corpse lands on the ground with a nauseating thud, looking even sadder than before.
links.polish: Jest cięższe, niż myślałeś – musisz je natychmiast upuścić z powrotem. Ciało uderza o ziemię z przyprawiającym o mdłości plaśnięciem. Wygląda jeszcze smutniej niż wcześniej.
links.belarusian: Гэта цяжэй, чым ты думаў – табе трэба яго адразу ўпусціць назад. Цела ўдараецца аб зямлю з агідным пляскатам. Яно выглядае яшчэ сумней, чым раней.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Damn, you're out of shape... In you..."
links.english: Damn, you're out of shape... In your defence, the corpse *was* quite slippery.
links.polish: Jasna cholera, ależ jesteś nie w formie... Na twoją obronę trzeba podkreślić, że ciało *było* mocno śliskie.
links.belarusian: Ясная халера, але ж ты не ў форме... На тваю абарону трэба падкрэсліць, што цела *было* моцна слізкім.

links.title: You: "Step on the corpse as you pull on t..."
links.english: Step on the corpse as you pull on the boots.
links.polish: Stań na ciele, próbując zdjąć buty.
links.belarusian: Стань на целе, спрабуючы зняць абутак.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "Something cracks in the left leg --..."
links.english: Something cracks in the left leg -- it really is about to come off. The leg, I mean. Not the boot.
links.polish: Coś trzaska w lewej nodze. Za chwilę naprawdę puści. Noga, znaczy się. Nie but.
links.belarusian: Нешта трэскае ў левай назе. Хутка сапраўды адпусціць. Нога, маю на ўвазе. Не боты.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "You may want to slow down. Don't te..."
links.english: You may want to slow down. Don't tear into it like that.
links.polish: Lepiej trochę zwolnij. Nie szarp aż tak gwałtownie.
links.belarusian: Лепш крыху запаволіць. Не рві так рэзка.

links.title: You: "Adjust his seating position first."
links.english: Adjust his seating position first.
links.polish: Najpierw popraw jego usadowienie.
links.belarusian: Спачатку палепшы яго размяшчэнне.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "He's too heavy to move by yourself..."
links.english: He's too heavy to move by yourself -- a great mass of dead muscles, with hoarfrost covering his milky eyes.
links.polish: Jest zbyt ciężki, żebyś mógł przenieść go sam – to ogromna masa martwych mięśni z oszronionymi przez bielmo oczami.
links.belarusian: Ён занадта цяжкі, каб ты мог перанесці яго сам — гэта велізарная маса мёртвых мышцаў з матавымі ад бельма вачыма.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Is that an accusatory glance he gav..."
links.english: Is that an accusatory glance he gave you? No... no, he's cool.
links.polish: Czyżby spojrzał na ciebie oskarżycielsko? Nie... Nie, dobra jest.
links.belarusian: Ці паглядзеў ён на цябе абвінаваўча? Не... Не, добра ёсць.

links.title: You: "Try to twist the boots off one by o..."
links.english: Try to twist the boots off one by one.
links.polish: Spróbuj obrotowym ruchem ściągnąć buty, najpierw jeden, a potem drugi.
links.belarusian: Паспрабуйце круцільным рухам зняць абутак, спачатку адзін, а потым другі.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "This is the right method. It takes..."
links.english: This is the right method. It takes some time, but eventually the boots come off -- with nasty slices of polymer sock stuck to even bigger pieces of skin and rotting flesh.
links.polish: To właściwa metoda. Zajmuje nieco czasu, ale ostatecznie udaje ci się zdjąć buty. Wraz z ohydnymi kawałkami polimerowych skarpet przyklejonych do jeszcze większych kawałków skóry i gnijącego ciała.
links.belarusian: Гэта правільны метад. Гэта займае трохі часу, але ў выніку табе ўдаецца зняць абутак. Разам з агіднымі кавалкамі полімерных шкарпэтак, прыляпленых да яшчэ большых кавалкаў скуры і гніючага цела.

links.title: You: "Take stock of the damage."
links.english: Take stock of the damage.
links.polish: Oceń uszkodzenia.
links.belarusian: Ацэніце пашкоджанні.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "Not good. Let's pin this on the bea..."
links.english: Not good. Let's pin this on the bear -- the ice bear tore up his legs with its claws. As for the boots -- you can't possibly do anything with them until you have cleaned and *disinfected* them thoroughly.
links.polish: Niedobrze. Zwalmy to na niedźwiedzia – lodowy niedźwiedź poszarpał nogi denata pazurami. Co do butów – nie nadają się zupełnie do niczego, dopóki ich dokładnie nie wyczyścisz i *zdezynfekujesz*.
links.belarusian: Нядобра. Звалім гэта на мядзведзя – ледзяны мядзведзь парваў ногі нябожчыка кіпцюрамі. Што да абутку – яны абсалютна ні на што не падыходзяць, пакуль іх дакладна не пачысціш і *дэзінфікуеш*.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Yes. These absolutely need to be wa..."
links.english: Yes. These absolutely need to be washed before. The stink is incredible.
links.polish: Tak. Zdecydowanie trzeba je wcześniej umyć. Smród jest niesamowity.
links.belarusian: Так. Варта іх загадзя памыць. Смурод неверагодны.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Didn't the Whirling have a kitchen?"
links.english: Didn't the Whirling have a kitchen?
links.polish: Czy w Whirling nie było przypadkiem kuchni?
links.belarusian: Ці не было выпадкова кухні ў "Вірленне"?

links.title: The Hanged Man: "The legs look like they've been cla..."
links.english: The legs look like they've been clawed at by wild animals. As for the boots -- you can't possibly do anything with them until you have cleaned and *disinfected* them thoroughly.
links.polish: Nogi wyglądają, jakby znęcały się nad nimi jakieś dzikie zwierzęta. Co do butów – nie nadają się zupełnie do niczego, dopóki ich dokładnie nie wyczyścisz i *zdezynfekujesz*.
links.belarusian: Ногі выглядаюць так, нібы над імі здзекаваліся нейкія дзікія жывёлы. Што да абутку – ён зусім не прыдатны, пакуль яго дакладна не пачысціш і не *дызайфікуеш*.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Yes. These absolutely need to be wa..."
links.english: Yes. These absolutely need to be washed before. The stink is incredible.
links.polish: Tak. Zdecydowanie trzeba je wcześniej umyć. Smród jest niesamowity.
links.belarusian: Так. Безумоўна, іх трэба папярэдне памыць. Смердзь неверагодная.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Didn't the Whirling have a kitchen?"
links.english: Didn't the Whirling have a kitchen?
links.polish: Czy w Whirling nie było przypadkiem kuchni?
links.belarusian: Ці не было выпадкова кухні ў Whirling?

links.title: Cunoesse: ""Look -- he's skinning the fucker u..."
links.english: "Look -- he's skinning the fucker up good. *Puukko* style."
links.polish: „Patrz! Nieźle goli zdechlaka. Skalpuje go jak *puukko*”.
links.belarusian: «Глядзі! Нядрэнна голіць мярцвяка. Скалпуе яго як *пуукко*».

links.title: Cuno: ""Hell. Keep at it, pig!""
links.english: "Hell. Keep at it, pig!"
links.polish: „A niech mnie. Tak trzymaj, świnio!”
links.belarusian: «А хай сабе. Так трымай, свіння!»

links.title: You: "Pull on the left boot."
links.english: Pull on the left boot.
links.polish: Pociągnij za lewy but.
links.belarusian: Пацягні за левы бот.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "It feels like the leg is going to c..."
links.english: It feels like the leg is going to come off along with the boot, but you are able to get the boot to move a centimetre or two.
links.polish: Masz wrażenie, że noga oderwie się zaraz razem z butem, ale udaje ci się zsunąć go o centymetr czy dwa.
links.belarusian: У вас ёсць адчуванне, што нага вось-вось адарвецца разам з ботам, але ўдаецца зрушыць яго на сантыметр ці два.

links.title: Cuno: ""Whoah. Cuno's little *sneak-pig's*..."
links.english: "Whoah. Cuno's little *sneak-pig's* back for the booty... "
links.polish: „Łooo! Mała *świnka-spryciulka* Cuno wróciła, żeby obrobić dupę...”
links.belarusian: «Ооо! Маленькая *свіння-хітруня* Куна вярнулася, каб абрабаваць зад...»

links.title: Cunoesse: ""Yeah, fuck it to pieces for us. Li..."
links.english: "Yeah, fuck it to pieces for us. Liar cop!"
links.polish: „Dalej, wydymaj go na całego. Kłamliwa glino!”
links.belarusian: «Давай, дай яму па поўнай. Ілжывы паліцыянт!»

dialogueTree.title: The Hanged Man: "Before you can grab hold of the boo..."
dialogueTree.english: Before you can grab hold of the boot, you hear a voice coming out of the dead man's mouth. It's the voice of Lieutenant Kim Kitsuragi, telling you to stop whatever you're doing.
dialogueTree.polish: Twoje ręce nie dotykają jeszcze buta, kiedy z ust zmarłego dobiegają cię słowa. To głos porucznika Kima Kitsuragiego mówiący, żebyś przestał, cokolwiek kombinujesz.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Твае рукі яшчэ не кранаюць абутак, калі з вуснаў памерлага да цябе даносяцца словы. Гэта голас лейтэнанта Кіма Кіцурагі, які кажа, каб ты спыніўся, што б ты ні задумваў.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "You're sabotaging the crime scene,..."
links.english: You're sabotaging the crime scene, and yet you haven't even finished the field autopsy. Come back later when you're done with the investigation.
links.polish: Dokonujesz sabotażu miejsca zbrodni, a nie zakończyłeś jeszcze nawet autopsji polowej. Wróć później, jak już zamkniesz sprawy związane ze śledztwem.
links.belarusian: Вы робіце сабатаж месца злачынства, а яшчэ нават не завяршылі палявую аўтапсію. Вярніцеся пазней, калі ўжо завершылі справы, звязаныя з расследаваннем.
